column4: Try the intel driver if you are using an intel card, remove 915resolution as it is not needed with the intel driver
i read that howto
intel driver? xorg-server-intel=
xserver-xorg-driver-intel IIRC, but yes
well, everyithing actually worked well before i installed that
this friend of mine complained about  his low resolution with the default installation system, so i've suggested him to install this package
and is since then, that the resolution got soo damn low
Did he also update his xorg.conf?
no but i did it remotely now (changed driver to i810)
That is the wrong driver, choose "intel"
that was the previously defined value :(
this is how the config looks : http://nd47.coderock.org/~azi/xorg.conf
1280x800 is the resolution you want?
well yes, but he's telling me the icons and everything are so uninmaginable hughe
Are you sure that is a resolution problem and not just that the icons are actually too big?
well, what else could have gone wronge switching to  xserver-xorg-driver-intel ?
also, you think i should not install :  xserver-xorg-driver-intel ?
Nothing that I can think of, ask him to let you VNC in from System -> Preferences -> Remote Desktop
he can't manage to do that
everything is too big ;-(
then enable it for him through ssh :)
never used that
what shall i run?
Don't actually know what vnc server Ubuntu uses by default, you can cheat by ssh -X ing in and running "vino-preferences"
